newsitem.title: BELGIUM: TESSENDERLO JUMPS 6% ON MARKET OPTIMISM.
newsitem.headline: TESSENDERLO JUMPS 6% ON MARKET OPTIMISM.

text.p: Shares in Belgian chemicals firm Tessenderlo jumped almost six percent on Tuesday as its high liquidity, recent acquisitions and interest in industrial stocks was attracting investors to the share.
"In a positive stock market it is normal that a stock like Tessenderlo is outperforming with its fundamentals in order," analyst Luc Van Der Elst at G-Securities told Reuters.
Analysts said investors were seeking industrial stocks, particularly chemical and pharmaceutical stocks as 1997 fundamentals were positive.
"Chemicals have done well in 1996 compared to other cyclicals, like steel shares," Van Der Elst said.
At 1210 GMT Tessenderlo was up 5.6 percent at 15,500 francs after earlier touching a high of 15,700 -- up 5.9 percent.
"It's been picking up companies recently, and has more liquidity which is reducing the cyclicality of the stock," Van Der Elst said.
Tessenderlo recently announced plans to buy French eperef SA and the acquisition of U.S. Chelsea Building Products, but maintains a low level of debt.
G-Securities said it was too early to sell the stock.
-- Paul de Bendern, Brussels Newsroom +32 2 287 6812, Fax +32 2 230 7710
